page.title: 14CHANGES IN GOLANT & LERRYN
page.content: The greatest change in{Golant happened in 1965 when the station was closed. Now only goods trains use the line which goes to{Fowey. An elderly resident of{Golant recalled how when the railway line was open, a favourite day out was to go on the train to{Lostwithiel,}then to{Par, then to{Fowey}and then return to{ {Golant. The school in{Golant}closed soon after the{Second World War. }The few children in the village are taken by bus each day to schools in{Tywardreath and{Fowey. Twenty years ago there were several{shops}in{Lerryn,}now there is only one{Post Office and general {store. }Many of the houses in{Lerryn have become{holiday homes.
